As this game approaches its 20th anniversary (only 17 at the time of this review), you probably have already heard about it, seen other people playing it, or have played it yourself and somehow forgotten the details. So, allow me to provide some context.

1) After replaying it recently, the game is still fun. Outside of nostalgia, the game mechanics hold up, the graphics (to me) still look good and appealing, and the pacing (for the exception of the Ravenholm and Lost Coast chapters) feels good from start to finish.

2) The difficulty, even on hard, isn't difficult by most contemporary game standards, I think. By no means do I play FPS games regularly, but I still beat it with little difficulty on the hardest setting. So, it's probably a reasonable choice for casual players.

3) The story is still kinda meh. I remember liking it on my playthrough prior to the one I'm writing this review on, but that was 8 years ago. Similarly, I remember liking the story when Half-Life 2 first came out in 2004. Now, though, it's just okay. It isn't bad by any means, and it makes sense why Gordon may be motivated. But it's pretty standard by contemporary standards. If you've played a sci-fi/dystopian/post-apocalyptic FPS, you'll see the tropes. So, if you're not nostalgic for the story, it probably won't be particularly resonate with you.

Overall, it's a good game and I enjoy playing it; however, it might not appeal to all players, especially those who are more accustomed to contemporary FPS games (I don't play those, so I can't really say where the differences lie other than there is a health meter and health pickups in this game, and it's definitely not a cover-shooter). If it's on sale or inexpensive from your perspective, it's probably worth the 7-10 hours of play you can get out of it.

Aged very very well apart from frequent loadspace and modding restrictions (due to numerous engine upgrade that for the game itself amounts to nothing but optimizations while breaking several mod functions).

Perhaps my only two bad points is how the "wepon" (SMG) can shoot grenade from its as small as the ballistics second barrel AND how very lazy Valve is to not implement Steam Workshop for this despite numerous engine upgrades!

[b]Pros[/b]
+ Best campaigns in a video-game. In pair with Half life (Black Mesa)
+ Level design. The guys behind it are true-genius
+ Graphics. Seriously, it's so good for a 2004 game
+ Exciting fights. It felt like war. The game sucks you in like you are part of it.
+ Immersive story
+ Amazing OST. "Triage at Dawn" might be the best song ever created for a game
+ The game offers moments of well-made suspense
+ Pure fun to play

[b]Score:[/b] 9/10
